other_tests.findings: Histopathology of a skin lesion was consistent with epidermodysplasia verruciformis (EV).
Positive for human papillomavirus types 5 and 8; Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) present in plasma with a load of 10,000 IU/mL.
Reduced percentage of CD3+ TCR-Vα24+ and TCR-Vβ11+ cells (<0.02%) compared to healthy controls (0.36% and 0.42%).
PHA-treated cells were capable of expanding and forming colonies; no differences between patients’ and control cells.
